Screen.title: TopScreen
Screen.Label: ---------- Mouse Button 1 click on field to change ----------

Help.Tip: Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
Help.Text:
tsmute - PROCESSDEFAULTS
Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
 
 Default = SYSTEM
 Allowed = SYSTEM
 Allowed = PROJECT
 Allowed = USER
 SYSTEM defaults are the defaults listed in the CPS documentation.
 
 PROJECT defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as Project
 Default button.
 
 USER defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as User Default
 button.

Screen.title: tsmute Process
Screen.Label: TSMUTE - Muting of the top salt
Header word number for trace type
TTYP_HNO=
Velocity of salt
SALT_VEL=
Minimum offset to mute
MUTE_MIN=
Change in offset of the top slope
TOP_OFF=
Change in depth of the top slope
TOP_DEP=
Change in offset of the bottom slope
BOT_OFF=
Change in depth of the bottom slope
BOT_DEP=
Mute taper length
TAPER=
Select the Velocity Option
VELOPT=
Velocity file
Refractor Horizon #
REF_HOR=
Header word number for top salt
SALT_HNO=

Help.Tip: -->Enter the header word number for the trace type
Help.Text:
tsmute - TTYP_HNO
-->Enter the header word number for the trace type
 
 Default = --> 49
 Allowed = --> A Header word number
 --> Header word number for the trace type

Help.Tip: -->Enter the velocity of the salt
Help.Text:
tsmute - SALT_VEL
-->Enter the velocity of the salt
 
 Default = --> 14000
 Allowed = --> A real value
 --> The velocity of the salt

Help.Tip: -->Enter the minimum offset to mute
Help.Text:
tsmute - MUTE_MIN
-->Enter the minimum offset to mute
 
 Default = --> 6000
 Allowed = --> A real value
 --> The minimum offset to mute

Help.Tip: -->Enter the change in offset of the top slope
Help.Text:
tsmute - TOP_OFF
-->Enter the change in offset of the top slope
 
 Default = --> 10000
 Allowed = --> A real value
 --> The change in offset of the top slope

Help.Tip: -->Enter the change in depth of the top slope
Help.Text:
tsmute - TOP_DEP
-->Enter the change in depth of the top slope
 
 Default = --> 2000
 Allowed = --> A real value
 --> The change in depth of the top slope

Help.Tip: -->Enter the change in offset of the bottom slope
Help.Text:
tsmute - BOT_OFF
-->Enter the change in offset of the bottom slope
 
 Default = --> 10000
 Allowed = --> A real value
 --> The change in offset of the bottom slope

Help.Tip: -->Enter the change in depth of the bottom slope
Help.Text:
tsmute - BOT_DEP
-->Enter the change in depth of the bottom slope
 
 Default = --> 2000
 Allowed = --> A real value
 --> The change in depth of the bottom slope

Help.Tip: -->Enter the mute taper length
Help.Text:
tsmute - TAPER
-->Enter the mute taper length
 
 Default = --> 200
 Allowed = --> A real value
 --> The mute taper length

Help.Tip: -->Select the velocity option
Help.Text:
tsmute - VELOPT
-->Select the velocity option
 
 Default = --> Velocity trace input
 Allowed = --> Velocity trace input
 Allowed = --> Velocity trace file
 Allowed = --> Velocity file
 Allowed = --> Modspec file
 --> Velocity trace input -- velocity trace data (TTYP_HNO=51) used
     for variable window analysis (average velocities)
 --> Velocity trace file -- velocity trace file (TTYP_HNO=51) used
     for variable window analysis (average velocities)
 --> Velocity File -- CPS velocity file (average velocities)
 --> Modspec File -- Modspec depth file (interval velocities)

Help.Tip: --> Use the file selection dialog to choose a Velocity file.
Help.Text:
tsmute - SELECT_VELNAME
--> Use the file selection dialog to choose a Velocity file.

Help.Tip: -->Use a file selection dialog to choose an Velocity file
Help.Text:
tsmute - VELNAME
-->Use a file selection dialog to choose an Velocity file
 
 Default = --> NONE
 Allowed = --> A file name
 --> The velocity file

Help.Tip: --> Status of the velocity file.
Help.Text:
tsmute - VELNAME_INFO
--> Status of the velocity file.
 
 Default = --> NONE
 Allowed = --> Status information
 --> Velocity file status information

Help.Tip: -->Enter the refractor horizon number
Help.Text:
tsmute - REF_HOR
-->Enter the refractor horizon number
 
 Default = --> 2
 Allowed = --> A number
 --> The refractor horizon number

Help.Tip: -->Enter the header word number for the top salt
Help.Text:
tsmute - SALT_HNO
-->Enter the header word number for the top salt
 
 Default = --> 48
 Allowed = --> A Header word number
 --> Header word number for the top salt

Help.Tip: Button that removes this process parameter screen.
Help.Text:
tsmute - CLOSE
Button that removes this process parameter screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Appears only on the view-only process parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
Help.Text:
tsmute - OK
Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values, runs the parameter traps and removes
 the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
Help.Text:
tsmute - APPLY
Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps but does
 not remove the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
Help.Text:
tsmute - CANCEL
Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =

Help.Tip: Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
Help.Text:
tsmute - RESET
Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that sets the parameters back to their values when the screen appeared
 or to their last applied value.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
Help.Text:
tsmute - PROCESSLISTLEFT
Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the previous process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
Help.Text:
tsmute - PROCESSLIST
Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Menu that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to any chosen process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
Help.Text:
tsmute - PROCESSLISTRIGHT
Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the next process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
Help.Text:
tsmute - PROJECTDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as Project Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of Project Defaults for a project.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
Help.Text:
tsmute - USERDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as User Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of User Defaults for a userid.

Help.Tip: Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
Help.Text:
tsmute - HELP
Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 The Help Window allows access to three kinds of help:  Parameter Help, CPS
 Process Help and Application (CFE) Help.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                         C P S   P R O C E S S
 
 Name       : TSMUTE
 Category   : velocity_analysis
 Written    : 2003-11-07   by: Michael Ried
 Revised    : 2006-10-16   by: D. Glover
 Maturity   : production
 Purpose    : Muting of the top salt
 Portability: No known limitations.
 Parallel   : No.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          GENERAL DESCRIPTION
 
 TSMUTE (Top Salt Mute) is used to apply surgical muting to remove head waves
 and converted shear waves that are generated at interfaces with large
 interval velocity contrasts.
 
 Surgical muting begins at the critical offset.  The top and bottom slopes
 are used to control how rapidly the surgical mutes expand beyond the critical
 offset.
 
 The critical offset is calculated using the following information:
   a) An average velocity model
   b) The depth of the horizon with the large interval velocity contrast
      (e.g., top salt)
   c) The interval velocity of the medium under the horizon (e.g., salt
      velocity).
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          ADVICE FOR USERS
 
 Use the MASKER process to put a horizon (e.g., top salt) into the trace
 headers. Use the TSMUTE menu to specify the location of the header word
 containing the horizon depth value.
 
 An average velocity trace can be attached to each Common Image Gather (CIG)
 that is input into TSMUTE.  Group the velocity trace with its respective CIG
 gather by using the following sequence in a CPS flow:
   TRIN (seismic) -> GATHER -> TRIN (velocity)
 
 The average velocity trace must have a value of 51 in header word 49.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                             REVISION HISTORY
 
     Date        Author        Description
     ----        ------        -----------
005. 2006-10-16  D. Glover     Added NULLIFY statements for Intel compiler.
  4. 2006-01-03  Michael Ried  Sample rate < 1 assumed to be in kilofeet
  3. 2005-02-21  Michael Ried  Increased the max # of reference refactor nos
  2. 2005-02-01  Michael Ried  Allowed process to read a modspec file
  1. 2003-11-07  Michael Ried  Initial version.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
